item.title: Wings Of Glory Codes (November 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Wings Of Glory monthly redeem codes for November 2025 to get free Tactical Medals, allowing players to progress through the levels of the game quickly. 

If you’re a fan of the legendary Tom Cruise movie Top Gun, then Roblox Wings Of Glory is going to be right up your alley. Wings Of Glory is a highly detailed combat flight simulator game that boasts over 150 aircraft, ranging from vintage classics to modern beasts. It features intense 10v10 dogfights in historical locations, allowing players to relive some of the greatest battles the world has ever seen. The fast-paced gameplay can provide hours of endless fun, with six different nations’ aircraft to choose from. Wings Of Glory has extremely realistic flight controls as well as highly customisable planes, making it the ideal game for fans of the aeronautical world. The progression system in the game allows players to get their hands on timely upgrades, but some additional rewards would go a long way, and that’s where the Wings Of Glory codes can come in handy. 

Active Wings Of Glory Codes

  • BEYONDVISUAL
  • WHYTHEBEEPS

Expired Wings Of Glory Codes

  • FINALLYHERE
  • MAVERICK

How To Redeem Wings Of Glory Codes

Unlike the controls and gameplay of Wings Of Glory, redeeming codes in the game is very easy, as it has no prerequisite steps. All that players have to do to claim the rewards is navigate through the menus and input one of the working codes into the correct text box. For players who may be new to the Roblox ecosystem, here’s a detailed step-by-step guide to redeeming the codes:

  1. Launch Roblox and open up Wings Of Glory.
  2. Click on the Twitter bird icon (Former X Logo) on the right side.
  3. Input one of the active codes into the text box that pops up.
  4. Click on ‘Redeem’ to claim your rewards.

How To Get More Wings Of Glory Codes

Roblox game developers often release new codes along with updates or special events, mostly through the game’s official Discord server or their socials. However, the easiest way for players to stay up to date with the latest codes would be to simply keep this page bookmarked and check in every now and then. We update this article as soon as any new codes drop, so you never have to worry about missing out on any more free rewards. 

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Releases Intense Launch Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Ahead of its November 14th, 2025, release, Activision has put out the Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 launch trailer. Despite rumors of an early release, this all but confirms it’s sticking to its launch date with no early access.

As the next mainline entry, Black Ops 7 is putting a big emphasis on multiplayer. With a co-op campaign and 18 launch multiplayer maps, it’s honing in on what fans want. Despite returning to the futuristic settings of games past, without jetpacks, it’s still one of 2025’s biggest titles. Now, we have the launch trailer for the upcoming FPS that showcases just about everything it has to offer.

Black Ops 7 Called “The Biggest Black Ops Yet” in New Launch Trailer

In the trailer, shown above, we see a lot of Black Ops 7, from its campaign to multiplayer and zombies. It does show off all of the game’s offerings through gameplay and cinematics. There’s some new footage like the return of Black Ops 2‘s Menendez and campaign locales, but it’s more or less the same. Still, it does state that Black Ops 7 is the biggest Black Ops game ever, which is a bold statement.

It remains to be seen if it will live up to the sub-series’ pedigree, given how well-received Black Ops titles are. Some of Call of Duty’s best titles were from Black Ops, like 1 and 2. Even then, Black Ops 6, which came out last year, was one of the more positively reviewed entries in years. As a fan of the series, I do hope Black Ops 7 lives up to the hype, even with the emphasis on multiplayer. We’ll know for sure as we head to November 14th.

What do you think of Black Ops 7’s launch trailer? What mode are you most excited to check out? Did you play the beta? What did you think? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Call of Duty, check out our articles on the Season One roadmap and launch times. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Final PC Specs Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
With Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 set to release on November 14, Activision has confirmed the final PC specs that players will need for the best performance on their machine.

No matter what type of PC build you have, it’s important to note that both TPM 2.0 and Secure Boot will be required to play the game. Also, online Intel and AMD CPUs are supported.

If you plan on playing on a handheld PC, Activision says that Black Ops 7 will run on “most Windows-based handhelds”. It will also feature optimized visuals and “sharper text” for the smaller screens. There will also be “smart power and battery optimization”.

For full machine builds, check out the rest of the recommended and minimum PC specs below. It’s also worth noting that the storage specs below are for Black Ops 7. More storage will be needed to install Warzone.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 PC Specs

Minimum Black Ops 7 Specifications

  • Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit (latest update)
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 1400 or Intel Core i5-6600
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 470 or NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 / 1060 or Intel Arc A580
  • Video Memory: 3 GB
  • Storage: SSD with 116 GB available space at launch
  • Additional Requirements: Broadband internet, DirectX 12, TPM 2.0 + Secure Boot

Recommended Black Ops 7 Specifications

  • Operating System: Windows 11 64-bit (latest update)
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 1600X or Intel Core i7-6700K
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 6600 XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 or Intel Arc B580
  • Video Memory: 8 GB
  • Storage: SSD with 116 GB of available space at launch

Competitive/4K Ultra Specifications

  • Operating System: Windows 11 64-bit (latest update)
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X or Intel Core i7-10700K
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 7900 XT or NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 / RTX 5070
  • Video Memory: 16 GB
  • Storage: SSD with 116 GB of available space at launch

How do you plan on playing Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 when it launches on November 14 for PC, PlayStation, and Xbox? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about NetEase shutting down one of its studios after just two years. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Australia To Ban Kick And Reddit For Children Under 16

Australia has announced that both Kick and Reddit are being added to the list of platforms included in the upcoming social media ban for kids.

Xbox Game Pass Games for November 2025 Wave 1 Revealed

Xbox Game Pass Wave 1 titles for November 2025 feature 6 Day One titles, including Call of Duty: Black Ops 7.

Nintendo’s Patent in Palworld Dispute is Being Reexamined by USPTO

The director of the US Patent office has ordered an ex parte reexamination of Nintendo’s patent in Palworld dispute.

Fallout-Like MMO ‘PIONER’ Launches Open Beta on Steam

With vibes that mimic Fallout and Escape from Tarkov, PIONER comes to Steam today with an open beta. Check out the full details here.
